text: Hi! I am trying to add conditional statement with in my custom email template, to hide certain email content when an attribute/property (personalization token) within my custom Object is Empty . `{% if personalization_token('p00000_custom_object.heroImage') != "" %}Display hero image table {% endif %} .` For some reason this doesn't seem to work. Can someone please help me here. Thanks in advance!
You should use `p00000_custom_object.heroImage is not ""` instead of with the personalisation token function
You will also need to use the programmable email beta if you are not already
I see. Let me try implementing that.

Hi Joe, `{% if 'p00000_custom_object.heroImage' ne '' %}Display hero image table {% endif %}` seems to still display a blank space instead of hiding the hero image table, when the heroImage property is empty.
You have the property as a string instead of it directly
Ah I see. I also enabled the programmable email beta, and seem to get an error - "Email Validation failed" while attempting to update the corresponding email.
Hi Joe, I was able to fix the email validation error. However the if condition doesn't seem to work. It still displays the black space. Please see my screenshot.

Hello Guys,

I have a workflow currently enrolling contacts and sending them a daily digest email that is populated from my hubdb table.

Each contact will receive the rows associated to him. Currently i am able to display a certain section in case a certain contact has no records associated to him.

Is there a way, not to send the email to a certain contact in case no rows were associated to him ?
